title: Scale-UP Cardano's Community Hubs
description: How do we encourage Local Community Hubs to drive adoption and awareness of Cardano in the next 6 months?

f6_assessments.q0:
Driving adoption and awareness of Cardano aligns with the Cardano mission of driving adoption of Cardano. The challenge makes a solid case about requiring users outside of the blockchain community and in local communities for growth.
I strongly agree this challenge is critical to achieve Cardano's mission.
f6_assessments.q1:
Scale-UP Cardano's Community Hubs is new to Fund 6. There are 32 proposals (7th largest of 18 Challenges) being assessed for $100K. The number of proposals was large relative to the size of the fund compared to other challenges which is indicative that this challenge has room to grow. The challenge is more than tripling its funding request in Fund 7.
Fund 6 proposals have not even been voted on yet so there is no way to know the cost effectiveness of this challenge yet. The recruitment cost should be under $5 per new user to be comparable to other challenges so a $10K community hub should bring in 200+ users within 12 months.
I agree that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The success criteria are relevant to the challenge question. 
The key metrics are relevant to the success criteria. It can be calculated from the metrics provided however the final reporting should include calculating the cost per user onboarded for each hub and aggregated for the entire challenge so that its effectiveness as a recruitment strategy can be compared to other challenges.
I  strongly agree that the success criteria and suggested metrics are set correctly to measure progress in addressing the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: Scaling up of community hubs is essential for mass adaption and decentralisation. It is important for this to continuosly focus on.
f6_assessments.q1: It is a diverse task that can be solved by various different skills and thus matches up to the diversity of the Catalyst community.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are comprehensible and coupled with a budget to make them quantifyable.

f6_assessments.q0: Encouraging onboarding through global community hubs will differentiate and strengthen Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Having seen previously many proposals related to the foundation of community hubs, I believe that the community will produce sufficient proposals to justify the 350k USD fund.
f6_assessments.q2: monitoring the establishment and success of hubs may be challenging in some cases.

importance: Without users on the ground level, we are building niche products serving mostly technical people with blockchain expertise.
success: Local Community Hubs across the world where the average person can take part in their own language and with their own cultural understanding
